07:26 <Kalleos> has joined #xwiki  
07:27 <Kalleos> Hi, I would like to create about 200 groups and many subgroup relations among them. I do not want to create and enter this manually by the web interface.. what alternative way can you suggest?  
07:28 <Kalleos> Should I check the mysql group table of xwiki and import records for those 200 groups?  
07:28 <gavin> has joined #xwiki  
07:28 <Kalleos> Should I check the mysql group table of xwiki and import .csv records for those 200 groups?  
07:28 <Kalleos> sorry for doubling the message  
07:30 <gavin> has quit  
07:33 <gavin> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <gavin> has quit  
07:37 <gavin> has joined #xwiki  
07:37 <vmassol> Kalleos: this might help you: http://snippets.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Create%20200%20Dummy%20Users  
07:38 <gavin> has left #xwiki  
07:46 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
07:46 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: seems there's still a blocker for the release  
07:46 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-user-directory-test-tests/3866/testReport/org.xwiki.user.directory.test.ui/UserDirectoryTest/org\_xwiki\_user\_directory\_test\_ui\_UserDirectoryTest/  
07:46 <vmassol> "Caused by: com.xpn.xwiki.store.migration.DataMigrationException: Failed to fix RecordableEvent problems."  
07:53 <Kalleos> yes.. that helps me... it's beautiful.. thanks  
07:54 <vmassol> mflorea1: the frst 3 screenshots at http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/Data/XWiki/9.3RC1/ are a bit largish don't you think?  
07:55 <vmassol> we should either re-upload them or modify the RN app to perform resize for images too large (I don't know how to do that though)  
07:58 <vmassol> Enygma`: missing "introduced in" on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionPoint/Content%20Menu  
07:58 <vmassol> (see the LT display)  
08:05 <Kalleos> Is it possible to restrict wikipages to users, which are members not only to 1 group, but 2 groups? I have a group "Company foo" and a Group "Division bar". Wiki Page should be accessible for users, which are both in foo and in bar  
08:06 <Kalleos> Or do I have to create groups for each combination of company and division?  
08:07 <tmortagne> I don't think that's possible  
08:08 <tmortagne> now I don't really understand this use case, isn't the Division your are toalking about a part of Company foo ?  
08:09 <tmortagne> s/toalking/talking/  
08:09 <Kalleos> It is  
08:09 <tmortagne> you can put groups inside groups  
08:09 <tmortagne> so given your setup I would put Division bar inside Company foo  
08:09 <Kalleos> I know.. this does not help..  
08:10 <Kalleos> sometimes access should be controlled across divisions of different companies..  
08:10 <tmortagne> what I mean is that if you are part of Division foo you are part of the company anyway, no ?  
08:11 <tmortagne> so you have a use case with a user part of two different division in different companies ?  
08:13 <Kalleos> actually, no  
08:14 <tmortagne> then I don't understand your need  
08:14 <Kalleos> ok, I try to formulate the use-case.. one moment..  
08:17 <Kalleos> I have for example 8 companies and each of them has 8 divisions. So in total we have 64 divisions. Each user is part of only one division and one company. How do I map it with xwiki groups? Do I have to create 8 company groups and 64 division groups? and this division groups I assign as subgroup to the company group?  
08:18 <tmortagne> yes you should create 8 company groups and 64 division groups  
08:19 <tmortagne> and put divisions groups in company groups  
08:20 <tmortagne> after that's what you have, will make much easier to set rights  
08:23 <tmortagne> s/after/after all/  
08:25 <Kalleos> Nevertheless it would be nice to have a feature, that wiki pages check that Users are within several particular groups... like if (user in Purchase\_Division and user in Europe\_Competence\_Area) then GRANT ACCESS  
08:26 <Kalleos> by that some more advanced matrix organizations could be mapped...  
08:28 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <tmortagne> I'm not so sure it such a common use case and people already complain about the complexity of the rights in XWiki :)  
08:36 <tmortagne> but sure you should create an issue on http://jira.xwiki.org  
08:40 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <mflorea> vmassol: regarding the screenshots, I don't understand what you want me to do. Isn't the release app responsible for displaying the images nicely? WDYM by reupload them?  
09:06 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <fcharton> has quit  
10:04 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
10:09 <vmassol> mflorea: right now the RN app doesn't do any resize when displaying in "Flow" view. The reason it doesn't do that is because I don't know how to do resize only if the image is above a certain size (I haven't researched it either TBH). So right now we need to upload images to the right size as otehrwise they appear too large in "flow " view  
10:11 <mflorea> I don't know what the "right size" means? As for "resize only if the image is above a certain size", you can probably use https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/CSS/max-width  
10:11 <mflorea> there's also max-height  
10:12 <vmassol> right size is defined in our best pratices  
10:12 <mflorea> do you have a link?  
10:12 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DocGuide#HScreenshots2FImages  
10:13 <vmassol> for RN pages full size might be too large for example  
10:13 <vmassol> when I get some time I'll upate the RN app to use what you said  
10:13 <vmassol> (max-width)  
10:16 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <mflorea> vmassol: the issue with max-width is that you would be overwriting the max-width:100% from the skin, and this will break the display on small screens (we will get a horizontal scroll bar). The best is probably to use max-width in combination with a media query. i.e. apply max-width:N only when screen size is larger than N  
10:19 <mflorea> i.e. "for screen widths larger than N limit the image width to N"  
10:20 <mflorea> (and thus keep max-width:100% for screens with width less than N)  
10:21 <vmassol> ok I'll need to check this out  
10:21 <vmassol> thx  
10:22 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: checking  
10:30 <vmassol> mflorea: created https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/RN-28 FTM

10:37 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki

10:52 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki

11:01 <Enygma`> vmassol: missed the extra fields because they are not exposed in the sheet  
11:01 <Enygma`> updating the object  
11:02 <gdelhumeau> org.hibernate.hql.ast.QuerySyntaxException: ActivityEventImpl is not mapped [select event from ActivityEventImpl event where event.page LIKE concat(event.wiki, ':%')]  
11:02 <gdelhumeau> It's the stracktrace I have on /home/gdelhumeau/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-user/xwiki-platform-user-directory/xwiki-platform-user-directory-test/xwiki-platform-user-directory-test-tests/  
11:02 <gdelhumeau> the mapping is located inside the activitystream-api jar, which is bundled  
11:03 <gdelhumeau> I cannot reproduce on XE  
11:03 <tmortagne> did your check hibernate.cfg.xml ?  
11:03 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <tmortagne> maybe the mapping is not there  
11:03 <vmassol> why is this new for user directory?  
11:03 <vmassol> it simply means the pom.xml is not correct  
11:03 <vmassol> but I don't undestand why now  
11:04 <gdelhumeau> why do you say the pom is not correct?  
11:04 <vmassol> so  
11:05 <vmassol> if you check the pom for user-directory tests you'll see it doesn't have the AS mapping  
11:05 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: the mapping is not on hibernate.cfg.xml, it's supposed to be inside the activitystream jar  
11:05 <vmassol> because each func test only brings the minimum  
11:05 <gdelhumeau> yes, but the jar is present in WEB-INF/lib  
11:05 <vmassol> doesn't matter  
11:05 <gdelhumeau> otherwise you would not even have the error  
11:05 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you are mixing two things  
11:05 <vmassol> you need the mapping to be there in the pom  
11:05 <tmortagne> the mapping file is in the jar yes  
11:05 <vmassol> but my question remains  
11:06 <vmassol> what's changed in the user dir ?  
11:06 <tmortagne> but hibernate.cfg.xml have to declare teh file  
11:06 <gdelhumeau> ok so the pom.xml is supposed to list all existing mappings ?  
11:06 <vmassol> no  
11:06 <vmassol> only the needed ones  
11:06 <vmassol> extra ones  
11:06 <gdelhumeau> nothing has changed on the user module  
11:06 <gdelhumeau> but now activity stream has a migrator  
11:06 <vmassol> then it shouldn't be needed  
11:06 <gdelhumeau> that requires a mapping to be set  
11:06 <vmassol> yes but it shoudl'nt run then  
11:07 <vmassol> AFAIK AS is not required for user dir  
11:07 <gdelhumeau> yes it is  
11:07 <gdelhumeau> I mean  
11:07 <vmassol> so the soiution is not to modify the pom  
11:07 <vmassol> but to remove the AS need  
11:07 <gdelhumeau> User directory dpends on Tags UI which depends on AS to display somethings  
11:07 <tmortagne> not for user directory but maybe we go to user profile for some reason  
11:07 <tmortagne> and user profile display a AS  
11:08 <vmassol> it's not user profile thomas  
11:08 <vmassol> it'e suser dir  
11:08 <vmassol> hmm why is Tags UI needing AS?  
11:08 <vmassol> also not sure why UJser dir depends on tags ui  
11:08 <gdelhumeau> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/33410f463ae2ff685c926a208ce144ea00b38139/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-user/xwiki-platform-user-directory/xwiki-platform-user-directory-ui/pom.xml#L63-L63  
11:08 <tmortagne> I know which module we are testing, but what is the URL when we get the error ?  
11:09 <gdelhumeau> and https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/33410f463ae2ff685c926a208ce144ea00b38139/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-tag/xwiki-platform-tag-ui/pom.xml#L41-L41  
11:09 <vmassol> ah yes ok for the tags ui need  
11:09 <vmassol> we test the tag cloud in the LT  
11:09 <vmassol> s/test/use  
11:10 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
11:10 <vmassol> so quesiton is why Tags UI requires AS  
11:10 <gdelhumeau> second link I pasted  
11:10 <vmassol> do you know why we need it?  
11:10 <tmortagne> if its http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ then it does not have much to do with user directory  
11:10 <vmassol> ah yes  
11:10 <gdelhumeau> "Needed when viewing individual tags "  
11:10 <vmassol> I read that ofc  
11:11 <vmassol> we display an AS of docs tagged with the tag  
11:11 <vmassol> I remember now  
11:11 <vmassol> ok so the deps are good  
11:11 <vmassol> now we don't need to run the migratoir  
11:11 <vmassol> and we shouldn't  
11:11 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: sure, the error is trigegred when the migrator tries to do its job  
11:11 <gdelhumeau> so whatever the URL  
11:11 <vmassol> since it's a clean packaging  
11:11 <tmortagne> there is no reaosn the migrator is executed  
11:11 <tmortagne> that's the bug  
11:11 <vmassol> yep  
11:12 <gdelhumeau> it's because of the DB version number I guess  
11:12 <Kalleos> has quit  
11:12 <tmortagne> the DB version number is set to the last number when initializing the DB  
11:13 <gdelhumeau> how this number is computed?  
11:13 <tmortagne> it ask the migrator which one has the biggest number  
11:13 <tmortagne> where is your migrator located ?  
11:14 <tmortagne> not oldcore I guess ?  
11:14 <tmortagne> I guess activity stream module is not in the classpath when the packager plugin create the DB  
11:15 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
11:16 <tmortagne> try to add activity stream api module to the plugin depedencies in xwiki-platform-user-directory-test-tests  
11:16 <tmortagne> that should do it  
11:18 <vmassol> you can search for "activitystream" in pom.xml for other modules  
11:18 <vmassol> (pom.xml of test modules that is)  
11:18 <tmortagne> it was not needed before  
11:18 <tmortagne> it's needed now because of the new migrator  
11:19 <vmassol> yes, but I still don't understand why we need the hibernate mapping  
11:19 <tmortagne> it's not the mapping  
11:19 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: not better  
11:19 <tmortagne> it's the migrator  
11:20 <tmortagne> the package create the DB and then we start XE and the migrator is executed because the version of the DB is lwoer  
11:20 <tmortagne> s/XE./XWiki  
11:20 <vmassol> yes we shouldn't have the migrator executed  
11:21 <gdelhumeau> so if you don't want the migrator to be executed, you need to have the correct DB version number, so you need AS API as dependency  
11:21 <gdelhumeau> at some point  
11:22 <gdelhumeau> I just would like to know how the mapping located inside the JAR is loaded and when  
11:22 <tmortagne> you need to have the migrator in the classpath when the DB is created the first time  
11:22 <tmortagne> it's loaded when you start XWiki the first time  
11:22 <tmortagne> hibernate see missing tables and automatically add them  
11:22 <gdelhumeau> before or after the migrator are executed?  
11:23 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: as I mentiopned  
11:23 <tmortagne> tables are always created before executing the migrators  
11:23 <vmassol> you need to search other pom.xml and you'll find that you need a dep under the packager plugin  
11:23 <vmassol> let me search for you  
11:23 <gdelhumeau> so anyway the migrator should  not complain abiut missing mappings  
11:23 <vmassol> so yo need:  
11:23 <gdelhumeau> even if it should not be executed at all  
11:23 <vmassol>     <xwiki.db.common.extraMappings>activitystream.hbm.xml,instance.hbm.xml</xwiki.db.common.extraMappings>  
11:23 <vmassol> +  
11:23 <vmassol> wait  
11:23 <vmassol> wrong paste  
11:24 <tmortagne> make sure you have AS as dependency of the plugin, not as dependency of the test module  
11:24 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/e9621a53bcade3f276fc0ebe0e756072a0146a78/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-watchlist/xwiki-platform-watchlist-test/xwiki-platform-watchlist-test-tests/pom.xml#L139-L139  
11:24 <vmassol>     <xwikiDbHbmCommonExtraMappings>activitystream.hbm.xml,mailsender.hbm.xml</xwikiDbHbmCommonExtraMappings>  
11:24 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: ok  
11:24 <vmassol> and something more=  
11:24 <tmortagne> yes same as https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/e9621a53bcade3f276fc0ebe0e756072a0146a78/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-watchlist/xwiki-platform-watchlist-test/xwiki-platform-watchlist-test-tests/pom.xml#L139-L139  
11:25 \* vmassol sent a long message: vmassol\_2017-04-19\_09:25:05.txt - https://matrix.org/\_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/SxDuxCbUiuzoMQufAYbxUDFS  
11:25 <vmassol> under  
11:25 <vmassol>         <groupId>org.xwiki.platform</groupId>  
11:25 <vmassol>         <artifactId>xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin</artifactId>  
11:26 <gdelhumeau> trying  
11:27 <vmassol> will be good to add some nice comment to the pom.xml to explain the need since it's far from obvious :)  
11:28 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <gdelhumeau> [WARNING] Failed to query the editors defined in wiki pages. Root cause: [MappingNotFoundException: resource: activitystream.hbm.xml not found]  
11:29 <gdelhumeau> I know  
11:29 <gdelhumeau> I haven't put the depency on the good location  
11:29 <gdelhumeau> what tmortagne told me earlier  
11:37 <tmortagne> ideally the packger plugin should load all the project dependencies when creating the DB to not miss things like this  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> ok so we have http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-user-profile-test-tests/testReport/org.xwiki.user.test.ui/UserProfileTest/org\_xwiki\_user\_test\_ui\_UserProfileTest/ too  
11:40 <tmortagne> Caused by: com.xpn.xwiki.store.migration.DataMigrationException: Failed to fix RecordableEvent problems.  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> yes, I will try the same fix  
11:41 <tmortagne> will need the cause of that, I see you fixed the missing exception parameter in a recent commit  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> I'm running it locally  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> it's the same problem  
11:42 <tmortagne> all tests that end up with activity stream will need to the same thing  
11:42 <tmortagne> probably a lot of tests  
11:42 <gdelhumeau> according to http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/ not that many  
11:49 <gdelhumeau> Enygma: sorry for your rlelease  
11:50 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: it's ok he is fighting with l10n :)  
11:50 <gdelhumeau> the SSL problem?  
11:50 <tmortagne> yep  
11:50 <gdelhumeau> ok thanks for your help guys  
12:45 <fcharton> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <floflobel> hi, i need to use html macro for show an audio controler but i have an error (https://paste.fedoraproject.org/paste/qJDVdT1qMPc12r7h34nz4l5M1UNdIGYhyRLivL9gydE=). I try to remove an empty line and the one doesn't display anithing.  
14:33 <vmassol> floflobel: you need to remove any spaces before and after the html marcro and make sure you have at least one new line befoe and after  
14:33 <OSIMasson1> has quit  
14:40 <floflobel> vmassol: i try to add new lines but either nothing appears. It's works perfectly on the lastest version (8  
14:41 <floflobel> vmassol: i try to add new lines but either nothing appears. It's works perfectly on the old version 7.1.2 but not on 8.4.4\*  
14:43 <vmassol> check the html produced maybe  
14:44 <vmassol> floflobel: you need clean=false  
14:44 <vmassol> {{html clean="false"}}...  
14:44 <vmassol> s/you need/maybe you need  
14:46 <floflobel> vmassol: It works perfectly, thanks!  
15:34 <floflobel> I need to create a custom menu with Document Tree. I tried this example but it doesn't work (http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document%20Tree%20Macro#HExcludenodesbasedontheirids). I replace $exclude and $filteredChildren (https://paste.fedoraproject.org/paste/N4BAHKWoRjc4Ee6LTNHN-V5M1UNdIGYhyRLivL9gydE=)  
15:50 <acotiuga> has quit  
16:00 <Nehagup\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:07 <Nehagup\_> Being a Java and a frontend enthusiast! I'm interested in improving l10n.xwiki.org . i applied with my gsoc'17 proposal for the same  but didn't get any reviews!  I would like get started with the project asap! Where can i get started from?
